updates.update_content:
Fulfillment is just around the corner! We encountered a little hiccup at the printers, but with the print run scheduled to ship out for Exalted Funeral's warehouse tomorrow—we're looking on track to fulfill within the next couple weeks (barring catastrophe)!
Last update, I promised teasers to sate your desires for shiny new art and photos of printed material after that hefty logistical drop. That's what we'll be doing here! Read on for exciting announcements, previews, and a from yours truly!
Shipping Details

TL;DR Summary: Expect an email in the next week directing you to pay shipping. Follow it to get your zines shipped!
Hello Backers! Fulfillment is nearly upon us. The offset run of over 2000 zines is currently at the printers and will shortly be on its way to our distributors. I'll stick a project status update at the end of this post, but first I want to walk you all through critical shipping details. I'll have a more exciting update with photos and WIPs for you soon, but first to business. Physical backers, please read on!
Paying for Shipping

The finish line pokes its tattered, gore-splattered head on the horizon. A small batch of test prints for The Drain are currently on the way to my house for review. Once I check them over and confirm they're all good, I'm pushing the button for the big order.
Assuming the print proof checks out, physical backers should expect an email directing you to finalize your PledgeManager order and pay shipping costs in about 2-3 weeks. I'll send out a backer update walking you through that process in more detail before that happens.

Hello all! I hope you've had a spiritually fulfilling Zine Quest and feel content with your new ascetic lifestyle offered by emptied wallets. I wanted to touch base now that Zine Quest is over and the deluge of celebratory updates you've all been receiving are winding down.
First, a bit of bragging. According to the invaluable Zine Quest stats that Pandatheist has been tracking over at their blog, 5 of the 10 most backed projects this 'Quest are 3rd party Mothership zines. Half of 'em! Out of nearly 400! A hearty congratulations to my sci-fi horror comrades for their success, and an enormous thanks to you, the community for making it happen.

Due to popular demand, we've just added new single-sided A3 posters featuring Andrew Walter's funnel map as an add-on to the pledge manager! If you've already gone through the pledge manager but want to pick up one of these posters, don't fret—you can unlock your order from your confirmation page which will take you back through the process and let you grab additional add-ons.

Wow. 
I certainly never would have believed we'd get this far. Over 1,400 backers, $15,000 raised, 7 stretch goals, and all in just 2 weeks. I'll be printing up more than 1,000 physical zines for all you backers, and I couldn't be more excited.
In addition to my enormous gratitude towards all of you, I'd like to thank everyone on my team who helped made this possible: Sean, Andrew, and CK for delivering some of the sexiest art ever produced for a Mothership module. Thank you again to CK for his gorgeous layout, and Fiona for shining up my words as brightly as they can possibly get. Particular thanks goes to Meredith for sticking with me throughout this whole wonderful ordeal, making the coolest Kickstarter video I have ever seen, and tolerating every innumerable request for mockups, graphics, and concepts. Last but certainly not least, thank you to every amazing person who agreed to come along for the ride and produce stretch goal content.

We're only $1,500 away from hitting our short film epilogue stretch goal! Since its announcement we've split the difference towards the final goal, and I know Meredith is itching to get started. We have under 36 hours to make it happen, but I believe in everyone's hunger for another unsettling trailer.
Art Announcement

campaign.story:
Seek the empty, the broken and dilapidated; it is closer than you think.
Search for the uncanny, the hidden and wrong; they are unsettling to you.
Observe this spot with your eyes, your hands and breath; let it inside you
Whisper so that only you may hear:
“I wish to see the vast in the dark”
And fall backwards without fear.

You are already there-
The sky is black as night, a tectonic rumbling can be heard overhead; the ruins sprawl out with a fractal madness, their shapes incoherent and puzzling; and a vast sea of colorless sand stretches out into the darkness, broken only by the titanic pillars that disappear impossibly into the lightless sky.
This is The Vast, a liminal realm hidden far away from our own. Always waning and on the verge of collapse, it is host to countless lost souls and alien treasures hidden within its crumbling ruins.
The Vast in the Dark is an exploration setting for the world’s most popular role-playing game and takes place in a crumbling alien wasteland filled with brutalist mega-structure ruins. It includes tools for generating massive areas to explore as well as unique player options and gameplay changes to keep the focus on player choice and ingenuity over dice-rolling and chance.
The Vast in the Dark Contains:
 Brutalist Alien flavor: the setting is a lightless wasteland populated by brutalist megastructures. Small societies of and factions have cropped up and settled within the various ruins attempting to survive and remain sane.
 No-Prep World Generation: The main goal of this zine is to provide GMs a toolbox to build a massive hexcrawl map, a local area within each hex, and dungeon complexes within those smaller local areas quickly and easily enough that you can do it on the fly (no prep work needed). 
 Player Options of The Vast: some feat/perks with flavor, from "Ruinplucker" to "Vacant Amygdala" designed to give "weird tools" for the player to use and exploit.
 Navigation, Inventory, and exhaustion system: quick down-and-dirty rules for surviving the wastes and how to run these areas without worrying about micromanagement.
 Optional Horror Elements: The Harrowing is a form of ego-decay, a slow erosion of the psyche that befalls all who find themselves trapped within The Vast. Linger too long and you will lose memories, joys, and even the drive to leave. It is only a matter of time before you become one of the Crawl...
 $1,000 USD - Custom Vast in the Dark Character Sheet - Free digital item available to all backers as a Printable PDF.
 $2,500 USD - Vast in the Dark Soundtrack - Commission a 15-20 minute soundtrack for use during sessions.
 $5,000 - Bundle of pre-printed Region, Settlement, and Ruin sheets are shipped along with all physical copies of the zine, so you can start generating your own worlds right out the package.
$17K - Printable Paper Minis - All backers get a PDF for printable minis of Characters and monsters for the Vast in the Dark.
$20k - Retailer Tiers - At this point I can start offering zines at wholesale discount to retail/online shops interested in stocking this weird little project!
For Zinequest 3 Feral Indie Studio will be releasing 3 zines over the course of the month. For those who are interested in our work and looking to save a bit of cash in the process, we will be offering a bundle discount of all three zines during each of our three campaigns.

campaign.story:
Shintiara: Crusade of Time is an original sci-fantasy RPG based on the 5th edition of the most famous role-playing game in the World that will catapult you into a game of time travels and temporal raids.
Things you can do playing Shintiara: Crusade of Time:
Explore 4D Temporal Dungeons
Activate Time Disruptors and Butterfly Effects
Use Paradox Points to activate temporal powers, such as Accelerate, Slow, Pass through Temporal Portals, Peek into the Future and many more.
Discover the 8 different Ages of the world collecting information and solving Mysteries.
Manage the Apocalypse Clock
Play one of the exotic new races of Shintiara or one of the new classes as the Chronoguardians

Published both in Italian & English.
Pubblicato in Inglese e in Italiano (ti manderemo il questionario quando il progetto sarà stato finanziato con successo). 
Shintiara: Crusade of Time will be published both in Italian and English
Have you ever dreamed of experiencing adventures like those in Umbrella Academy, Star Trek Discovery, Tenet, Back to the Future, Prince of Persia, Time trap, Avengers Endgame in your own 5th edition game sessions? That's exactly our goal, proposing this setting.
We developed 6 playable races, 3 new classes, dozens of character options and rules to manage Time Travel, 20+ New Monsters (together with the Time Dragon!) and Temporal Dungeons. Everything ready to be introduced in your 5th Edition campaigns. 

Download the Quickstart and start your next session jumping through time!
Quickstart available both in English and Italian.
Download the Quickstart (70 pages), learn the basics and play your first Temporal Dungeon!





Shintiara is a world that combines sci-fi and fantasy, a planet dilated by temporal paradoxes that exists on the event horizon produced by Siray, the sun, and Murya, the black star.
On the planet of Shintiara, the Recruits exploit Paradoxes (namely items and places from other ages) and Powers that bend time, driven by an apocalyptic vision and with the aim of favouring their Factions.
A long time ago, the two stars Siray and Murya which the planet orbits around were in harmony. Shintiara danced in the space around them for millions of years until, about three hundred years ago, the catastrophic events of the Great Darkness changed everything. For reasons unknown, Murya collapsed, turning into a strange black hole and rupturing space-time around Shintiara.
Murya, the black star, continuously attracts the planet and breaks the flow of time
At that very moment, time was ruptured and an unheard-of clash began: on one side lies Siray, that exerts its influence in order to maintain the planet in the Cosmos, on the other lies Murya, the black star, that threatens to make all time end.
As a Recruit in the Crusade you can shape time as you please, without magic or technology. You can navigate the flow of time either to prevent the Apocalypse or to bring it about.
If it happened, the Apocalypse would be permanent. No journey through time could ever go beyond it.
Recruit! Accept the consequences of your vision: a new portal has opened already and the Crusade of Time needs a new hero!

Playing in the world of Shintiara is an exciting and kaleidoscopic succession of adventures, in which characters will literally move and think in four dimensions. Every player character is a Recruit, a scholar and expert of time and its Paradoxes who can bend time.
Explore a planet full of magic and technology
Accumulating too many Paradoxes or activating your temporal powers too often can also, however, lead to unpleasant consequences. For example, it is not such a good thing to be inside a temporal maelstrom. Unfortunately for you, creatures and time are fickle, and at times generate places that defy the laws of physics: temporal dungeons, areas of Shintiara that rise within the mazes of Veils. 
A temporal dungeon is a space and a place which is situated around one or more Veils (time portals). This space and moment in time bends the usual laws of physics and time. After entering the Veil one will end up in the same map, but in years or Ages away.
Take great care during your missions!




 Shintiara exists, through time, in eight different Ages, though some documents state otherwise. 
All Recruits can accumulate tachyon energy in the form of Paradox Points. They can spend Paradox Points to activate many different effects, also called base temporal powers, such as Accelerate, Slow, Pass through a Veil, Peek into the Future and many more. 
The only way to journey through time is via Veils, which as stated are the thinning of boundaries between different Ages and dimensions.






On Shintiara there are seven sentient races who live on the main continent and are directly involved in historical and temporal events: Humans, Darqarots, Garduans, Skirths, Wyspers, Zolkanians and Zyrkuls. 
Darqarots (playable). Biped humanoids with hooves and horns, the Darqarot are a race in rapid physical and social evolution, used as slaves by humans for centuries.
Garduans (playable). Equipped with bat or demon-like wings and lean, skinny bodies, the Garduans are renowned for their warrior culture and ability with firearms and ranged weapons. Garduans are considered harbingers of misfortune by other races.
Skirths (playable). Peoples of Shintiara call the Skith the Opposite People. This nickname has been given to them for two typical traits: the innate ability to climb upside down and the tendency to act contrary to any expectation. From childhood, a Skirth learns to smile instead of crying and often expresses itself by stating the opposite of what it thinks.
Humans  are divided into many different playable Cultures, each with its own peculiarities and Social Traits.
Wyspers (playable). The mysterious Wysper are a race of spirits of light from the dimension of Spirits, also called the Otherworld. During the first phase of their life, for sixty years they take on a material body with humanoid shape of noble traits and white, luminescent skin.
Zolkanians (playable). Just by looking at one, a Zolkanian betrays its true “extra- dimensional” or “extra-terrestrial” origin. Quite short and slender in build, these humanoids possess a much larger bald head if compared to a human of the same size. Their skin ranges from blue, light blue and aquamarine.
 Zyrkuls (unlockable). Short in stature but with powerful muscles, it is said that Zyrkul are linked by a hive mind that, whenever necessary, takes over and controls them from afar. The colour of their scales seems to vary according to the role they play in the Hive, their social organization.
Each of these races, as well as all sentient creatures on the planet, interact with each other also according to the culture that their communities possess.
New race: the Wyspers

Every race on Shintiara possesses an additional trait called Culture which represents what one’s own native community deems useful or appropriate. There are eight types of culture and each character inherits their culture from the place or civilization they grow up in. One’s own Culture and Temporal Renown guarantee access to Social Traits and Cultural Feats.
New race: the Garduans
Magic and technology will fuse and become one in the more advanced ages of Shintiara. This has resulted in the generation of technological spells, which have special rules:  they may, for example, have properties as items do or hack into devices which have digital components. The Recruit’s Guide to Shintiara: Crusade of Time will cover these and many other rules & options.
New Class: the Chronoguardian

The Recruit’s Guide to Shintiara: Crusade of Time will contain 3 new classes (Chronoguardian, Voidwalker and Timedancer) numerous archetypes and backgrounds, as well as skills and spells from Shintiara’s history.
About the Chronoguardians 
For a Chronoguardian time is always in danger. Not all of them agree on what the danger or its source is, but they all regard the flow of time as a river infected with the very idea of the Apocalypse. The main objective of chronoguardians is to keep Paradoxes and time travel under control, as well as to spy on the actions of the Void faction in order to prevent temporal collapse. 
Would you like more info? Take a look at the Quickstart and attached character sheets!





Every adventure or campaign in Shintiara treats the Apocalypse as one of the protagonists. The Apocalypse is expected at the end of the Eighth Age and the ways in which it will happen are uncertain. Certain events, however, might manage to shift it either forwards or backwards in time.
                                The shifting of the Apocalypse is managed by the Chronicler via the Apocalypse Clock, a circle divided into the eight Ages of Shintiara and twenty-four circles or phases.
The Apocalypse Clock
All the rules and suggestions to manage the Apocalypse Clock will be insterted in the Chronicler's Codex rulebook.

campaign.story:
Welcome to ‘Svalbard' - a roguelike tabletop adventure
‘Svalbard’ is a standalone scenario that borrows elements from the world of H.P. Lovecraft. Through investigation, awareness, recollection and action, the players will experience a time-bending and relentless scenario!
The scenario is set in the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard close to the North Pole in the year 1993. The players are resourceful soldiers sent to explore the mysteries surrounding a secret Russian mine deep below the frozen landscape. As time is running out, the players need to stop an experiment gone horribly wrong; a warp in the time-space continuum that threatens to unleash the mad will of the daemon-sultan Azathoth.
The main mechanism of ‘Svalbard’ is to Explore, Die, Repeat. If you have seen the movie “Edge of Tomorrow”, played the board game “Time Stories”, read the book “All you need is kill” or know the concept ‘roguelike’ from video games, that’s what we’re talking about. If you know none of it, here’s a quick explanation:
In this scenario, the characters will die a lot. But it is not a permadeath; they “respawn” and bring back into the game their accumulated knowledge prior to their death needed to progress. As they start to uncover the secrets and puzzles of the scenario, they start to learn how to avoid their deaths altogether, and the goal of the scenario is no less than a “perfect run” where the players complete the entire scenario without a single death!
The layout of this book is centred around a specific concept; Rooms. Each page (or sometimes two pages) explains a specific room in the mine. Each room has challenges that need to be overcome, and information needs to be gained. The challenges are often lethal, but as said above; the characters are respawned if killed. Thus, they’ll 'learn' how to deal with each room if they’re killed, and upon their return after respawning, they’ll know how to progress.
Your players have never experienced anything like this in a role-playing game before. 
Welcome to ‘Svalbard’

'Lovecraftian': Whereas our first scenario, 'Pax Cthuliana', was heavily influenced by the Cthulhu Mythos, 'Svalbard' takes a lighter approach. Yes, the world is threatened by the deity Azathoth, and yes, horror plays a crucial role, but 'Svalbard' cannot be said to be a classical Cthulhu scenario. It may easily be run by players/GMs without any knowledge of Lovecraft/Mythos at all.
Action-oriented: 'Svalbard' demands an action-oriented approach. That's why 'Svalbard' comes with a set of pre-determined characters; a team of lethal, specialized, trained soldiers.
System: 'Svalbard' comes with an included, very simplified game system. It is tailored to the action-paced story and the central 'Time Unit' mechanic. If you would like more dice rolling or adaption to your own preferred system, you'll find the scenario easily adaptable, as long as you incorporate the Time Unit mechanic.
Time Unit mechanic: Our former scenario, ‘Pax Cthuliana’, could be played without a single die roll, as all progress was connected to handouts the players needed to decipher and deduct information from.
In ‘Svalbard’, we’ve taken kind of a similar approach, based on our Time Unit mechanic. This mechanic does not demand any die rolls, only a tiny bit of bookkeeping. 
Let’s explain: The players will enter Rooms, learn stuff, die, and later return to the same Rooms, but now with the knowledge that might keep them alive and helps them progress through the scenario.
To keep things tense, to encourage good judgement and to make smart choices, we’re introducing the concept of a finite time; that is, the scenario must be completed within a set period of time, or else Azathoth is unleashed upon the world and the players lose the scenario!
This finite time is called Time Units (TU). The scenario starts at 8 TU before time runs out and they lose. As they explore and learn and do things, time will go, and TU might be lost. Inevitably, the characters will die/respawn during the game, but upon their return, they might now have the knowledge of how to reduce the amount of TU spent on different tasks.
An example: The characters see a computer they know holds a password they desperately need. To obtain the password, 1 TU is spent to work into its files to find it. You see? There is no die roll, only the expense of TU. But the best of all? If they get the password, die sometime later and then respawn, they already know the password, and does not have to access the computer at a later run! 
This is the spirit of ‘Svalbard’; learn the secrets of the scenario, do smart choices, and allocate your TU wisely so you may complete the scenario within the allocated time and stop Azathoth!
To keep track of the spent TU, the scenario includes a simple TU track. Actually, we’ve included several tracks, so you may choose the one you like (or create one of your own). As the game begins, place the included TU marker (or something of your own choosing, like an old coin or a dragon bone fragment) on the “8” space. As TU is spent, just move the marker down accordingly. They use 1 TU to do a task? Move the marker 1 TU down. If it reaches 0 before they’ve completed the scenario, they’ve lost.
If you are interested in the full intro story of the scenario, check out our Update # 7 

With help from you, unlock FREE ITEMS and make this scenario become even greater!

UNLOCKED!!!!      Custom-made soundtrack!
We’re able to produce a custom-made soundtrack for the scenario, available FREE for ALL backers through download! Thanks all for being part of this!

UNLOCKED!!!! More artwork!
This stretch goal enables us to add more artwork to the scenario, making the horrors come even more alive!

UNLOCKED!!!! : High-resolution maps!
All maps for the game will be adjusted and made high-res; ideal for virtual desktop! 

UNLOCKED!!!!: Custom-made GM screen to 'Svalbard'!
Reduce or even eliminate the need to flip through the scenario during play with this custom-made GM screen! Inside, you'll find the map layout, important NPCs, a brief description of all Rooms etc., while the outside screen features scenario outwork! The GM screen will be FREE for all backers at ALL levels in PDF format, but also with the option of having DriveThruRPG print if for you for an extra cost of about USD 4.

UNLOCKED!!!!: ‘Svalbard’ tokens available as add-ons!
Behold our special made ‘Svalbard’ Tokens in solid stone and delivered in a polished, wooden case!
 These tokens double up as props in the game, as well as functioning as a marker on the Time Unit track!
The first token displays the letters ‘UNITOZ’, short for ‘Unichtozheniye’, the Russian word for 'Annihilation’. The second token has UniToz written in Cyrillic letters; ‘УниТож’ (short for ‘уничтожение'). In ‘Svalbard’, UniToz is the name of a military research project created back in 1953 by order of Soviet leader Joseph Stalin. In the game, the research project unexpectedly threatens to free the daemon god Azathoth himself upon the world.
The third token displays our interpretation of the Elder Sign, as created by H. P. Lovecraft himself in 1926. First mentioned in his work ‘The Dream Quest of Unknown Kadath’, it’s a protection against the evil forces of the Mythos.
You can but these Tokens individually or as a collection of all three in a special made case. They are available in the add-on section of this campaign.
Each Token costs USD 8 or USD 19 for the complete set of three.
Weight Token: ca. 23 grams.
Diameter Token: ca. 35 mm.
Thickness Token: ca. 6 mm.
Weight Wooden Case: ca. 8 grams.
Length Wooden Case: ca. 50 mm.

UNLOCKED!!!   Embroidered Patch Badges!
As the PCs explore the Russian mine, they'll soon encounter its guardians and researches. They are all identified by their badge on their clothing; the Russian abbreviation 'CCCP' and the name of their project: 'UniToz/Unichtozheniye'; the Russian word for annihilation... This Stretch Goal was reached with only 6 hours left of the campaign! As such, there was no time to make it into an ordinary add-on. Therefore, we’ll keep you informed about this in coming updates, including layout, price etc.

NOK 220.000 (about US/EUR 22.000): FREE Embroidered Patch Badges!
At this level, we want to celebrate and reward your part of this campaign by giving away a FREE* Embroidered Patch Badge to all backers at all levels (shipping not included). It will also unlock the option of buying additional badges for half the original price as an add-on.
* A handling fee of NOK 1 (ca. 0.1 USD/EUR) occurs, but that's as good as free, right? ;)

NOK 250.000 (about US/EUR 25.000): TBA
If we get close to this, we'll unveil even more plans for Stretch Goals!
PAX CTHULIANA
Get our first scenario, 'Pax Cthuliana', for a discounted price during this Kickstarter campaign! Through investigation, puzzle-solving, time travel, knowledge of the Mythos, situational music, timed events and horrible scenes, the players will experience an interactive scenario—an epic mini-campaign playable in one (long!) gaming night.
PRAISE FOR PAX CTHULIANA
“…the players [will be] talking about this adventure for years to come”. GeekNative.com
“…one of the best adventures I have read”. Goodreads.com
“Extremely impressed…I highly recommend it!”. Seth Skorkowsky.
“It’s smart, interesting and well put together, which are three qualities you don’t often see in one place”. Bud’s RPG Review.

More add-ons to come if we reach our Stretch Goals!

About the creators

Jarle Haktorson is the lead author behind 'Svalbard'. He grew up playing computers such as C64 and Amiga, role-playing games as AD&D an Call of Cthulhu and board games as Shogun and Axis & Allies. He is a senior high school teacher, the leader of the local gaming club, and still plays on computers, board games and RPGs as often as he can, at least once a week. He is proud to be a geek.

Even Vinjor Røssland is a co-author on 'Svalbard'. He is the creative mind behind the Insight Fantasy RPG and several other publications at drivethruRPG.com. He started playing RPGs back in the late 80s. Taking the GM-role some years later, he has entertained countless people through genres such as fantasy, sci-fi and horror. He has done all the layouts, bookbinding, advertising etc. for this scenario and campaign.

Joseph Diaz created most of the art for our previous scenario 'Pax Cthuliana' and was rehired for 'Svalbard'. He has worked as a concept artist for productions like Game of Thrones, Warcraft, Europa Report and Sleepy Hollow. Introducing Mattias Zeballos and Megvin Gjovari, they have given life to 'Svalbard' with their powerful illustrations.

Two Starving Gnolls (TSG): When Jarle and Even sit down to talk, their heads spin with ideas. TSG was created to set those ideas into motion. As such, TSG functions as a development team to convert RPG ideas into playable material. 'Svalbard' is their second such idea made a reality, 'Pax Cthuliana' being their first. There will be more...

campaign.story:
For years, sci-fi tabletop gamers have been struggling to find high quality assets (or even any assets at all in many cases). It's finally time to stop letting Fantasy have all the fun and start a golden age of sci-fi content!
Sci-fi delivery with table service
By backing, you'll get access to the Masters Toolkit software, the Sci-Fi Essentials pack and up to three extra content packs that expand on three key genres of sci-fi: Cyberpunk, Deep Space, and Wasteland.
Each pack contains both mapping and audio assets, so your games can sound just as good as they'll look!

Do you own the toolkit already? Click here!


All content packs will be given an early access release, followed by 10 weekly content updates. 
Important to note: These content packs can only be used with the Master's Toolkit software (explained below), but your creations can be exported and used in any VTT or  built upon in other map makers.

 THE CORE PACK - SCI-FI ESSENTIALS 

Releasing end of APRIL 2021
A strong base pack containing all the assets required to run a core sci-fi adventure, be it cyberpunk, outer-space, or post-apocalyptic.
Backers will get access to this pack with all reward tiers.
Here are a few examples of what you'll be getting with the Sci-Fi Essentials. Each of these are made with individual assets, and built in our Master's Toolkit software.
A modern hangar and warehouse
More warehouse + storage
Streetside parking
A modest apartment across from the bar
The roof is usually the weak point
Small exploration vessel - top level
Small exploration vessel - bottom level
Compound - Command center
Compound - Staging area
Wild West - Saloon
 Pack #1 - CYBERPUNK 

Releasing JULY 2021
Whether you're meeting a contact at the local nightclub or hacking into a mega corporation, the CYBERPUNK pack has got you covered!

A comprehensive asset pack including the following themes:



 Pack #2 - DEEP SPACE 

Releasing OCTOBER 2021
Millions of miles away from home, orbiting an alien planet, only the DEEP SPACE pack has the tools you need to survive.

A comprehensive asset pack including the following themes:
 PACK #3 - WASTELAND 

Releasing DECEMBER 2021
Society has collapsed and you need to pick up the pieces. Don't even think of venturing out into the desolate, radiation-filled wastes without the WASTELAND pack!

A comprehensive asset pack including the following themes:

THE MASTERS TOOLKIT
The Master's Toolkit, available on 64bit Windows and Mac OSX, is the ultimate tool for Game Masters. 
Actively in development for 3 years, with both a stable and beta version available at your fingertips at all times, The Master's Toolkit will provide the most immersive experience your table has ever known.

 PREPARE YOUR ADVENTURES 
The Master's Toolkit is built for Game Masters, providing everything you need to prep your games in the one application: A deep and robust battlemap creation tool, a full audio management suite, and a note and campaign management tool, all talking to each other through our powerful content linking system.
We provide multiple modules that all seamlessly work together and talk to each other, so that when you're in-game, you can stay in the world.
Link your maps to each other to seamlessly move through your world
Link your notes into your maps for easy reference
 THE ULTIMATE MEATSPACE TOOL
The Master's Toolkit is the best companion on the market for your in-person games. Native multi-screen support lets you project encounters to your living room TV, digital table, projector etc. via HDMI without loss of quality and with no need to run multiple instances of the software. Up to 8 screens are supported, with options for player maps, player handout screens, and extra GM-Only screens.
Couch hangout tabletop night anyone?
Minis and props work really well with digital
Digital at the table
NO INTERNET REQUIRED
Does your internet frequently drop out? Do you like to play in a cabin in the woods?
After a quick, one-time online authentication, The Master's Toolkit can be used fully offline with no limitations.
*Internet access is required to download purchased content packs.

USE YOUR OWN CONTENT
We can't provide assets for every possible encounter that your players may face, so we let you import as much content as you like! 
The following file formats are supported:
 Audio: OGG, WAV
 Images: JPG, PNG
 Video: MP4, M4V
 Animation: GIF, PNG Sequence
WEBM will be arriving in the near future :)

USER-FRIENDLY BUSINESS MODEL
Our business model is simple - You shouldn't pay twice for something you've already bought.
We don't do subscriptions. 
We don't charge for updates to content packs or software.
You buy it once, you own it forever. 

 COMMERCIAL USE
All Arkenforge map assets come with a full commercial license. You can use them in any commercial product, be it an official module, a Patreon map creator, or even just a board game.
We just need attribution :)


The Master's Toolkit comes with a number of modules, each catering to a different aspect of your game, be it audio, maps or notes. Each of these modules can communicate with each other to provide a seamless experience when it matters: During your game.

Cartographer
Our Cartographer module provides an infinite canvas for your mapping pleasure. The only limitation is your hardware!

Build on any grid
Square, hex, and isometric grids are fully supported
Customise your grid in any way you like! Grid snapping works as intended on all grid types

Bring your maps to life
Our high quality animated content instantly breathes life into any map. Animations can be set to loop or be one-off triggers, and allow for fully adjustable framerates.
Life in the void
Floating drones are a staple of ANY sci fi adventure
Long distance wormhole travel. Wait, why do we need a ship again?
Light up your world
A full ambient and dynamic lighting engine allows you to realistically set the mood. Whether your party has a standoff at high noon, or wants to approach in the dead of night, your map will look exactly as it should.
Run your maps during the day, evening, or night, without needing to rebuild anything
Climb the highest tower
Our mapping engine supports an infinite number of levels, allowing you to build every floor of your skyscraper on the one map, and seamlessly move between them.
Fight your way through an entire multi-level ship in the one map
Customise your content
Every image can have its hue, saturation, brightness and transparency altered, greatly increasing the versatility of each asset.
The Master's Toolkit treats every asset you import as one of our own, allowing it to be layered, manipulated, and built on top of.
Is it meant to be that colour...?
Export your maps
Looking to run your games online? We have static image export presets built in for all major VTTs, as well as automatic line-of-sight data export to Fantasy Grounds Unity.
Need something a little more atmospheric? Export your map as a 1080p video, complete with animations and all active audio, for use in VTTs such as FoundryVTT.
If you prefer a more tech-free setup, export your maps to PDF at any paper size you like. The Master's Toolkit will automatically slice up your map and arrange it over your pages for hassle-free printing!

Soundscapes
The most powerful audio solution on the market for your tabletop adventures, with access to hundreds of pre-built sound ambiences, music playlists, and one-off, hotkey-able sound effects in every pack, and the most in-depth customisation options available.

Music - your way
Every song provided in official Arkenforge packs offers individual instrument control. Did your soldier just shoot the drummer? Mute the drum track!

Set the scene
Build your sound effects into looped ambiences or edit one of the many provided, with controls for timing, pitch, panning and more!

Your sound at your fingertips
Use our custom Hotkey system to set hotkeys for as many sound effects as your keyboard can handle, including your imported ones!

See our Soundscapes in action

Scenario mode
Running your games has never been easier with Scenario Mode. With all of your content at your fingertips, you'll never need to stop the game to find that note again!

Control the battlefield
Use fog of war to control what your players can and can't see or hide any content from view with a simple 'hide' button.

Your own display
Have a completely separate display from your players, allowing you to access and modify anything in your game without your players knowing. 

Link your content
Our Content Linking system allows you to embed any content into your map, and access it with the click of a button. Move to new maps, start a new song or access a prepared note for a room.

See it in action!
The Master's toolkit used for the Zaranthurul Funrun event
The Master's toolkit used for DnD 5e by Ben Byrne at ArcOnline21
The Master's Toolkit used for Call of Cthulhu by Mark Morrison for his Reign of terror campaign


Stretch goals


The Master's Toolkit has been in development since June 2017. After its initial Kickstarter, it took wings and the alpha has been open to the public since  April 2018. We are publishing regular updates about the development process and plans on the Arkenforge website, Facebook, Twitter, but we mostly interact with our audience on our Discord server.
We are incredibly community driven and the more feedback we can get (no matter how brutal), the better. Based on community feedback and testing, we have continuously worked to improve the software to ensure that it is intuitive, easy to use, optimized, and accessible.
The next iteration of our software is expected to go live in April alongside the Sci Fi Essentials pack, with new tutorials and a much more optimised system.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Budget and timeline is always a concern for projects like these. We've been spending the last 3 years perfecting our asset creation and release cycle, and our last pack 'Dungeons Deep', was completed in a 10 week cycle. With the lessons we've learnt over the years, we are able to scope out and create a large amount of content in a short amount of time

In the event that this project does run later than expected, full rewards will still be given, just at a slightly later date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We create subscription-free software that can be used without an internet connection, allowing for near-infinite use with one single purchase.
Reusability and recyclability
All of our assets are digital, so we're 100% packaging waste free :)
Sustainable Distribution
By distributing assets completely digitally, our carbon footprint is negligible compared to the delivery of physical goods.

updates.update_userinfo: The Master's Toolkit rollout - Postmortem and Next Steps
updates.update_content:
Hey folks!
It’s been a little over two weeks since we launched the v0.4.0.0 update and sent out the first wave of KS rewards, and boy did everything go wrong. Today we’ll explain what failed and why, how we fixed it, and our near-term plans to help get everything to run 100% smoothly again.

First off, the dreaded content server.

Hey folks!
Our software key email claimed that you should add both products to your cart, then apply each coupon.
It turns out that our store doesn't actually support this, so instead: purchase one product at a time, and only use the associated code for that product in the checkout. That's two transactions total.

updates.update_userinfo: Sci Fi Essentials keys are going out!

It's happening! Sci Fi Essentials keys are being sent out right now :)
Some of you may have got a subject heading in your email containing the words "Test only". This is a slight mistake on our part. These are still the keys you are intended to receive :)

We'd recommend waiting a good day or two before downloading them, as the large number of downloads are slowing our servers a little. We've also got a bit of bug fixing to do over the week, as the large influx of users has found some bugs that our beta testing process didn't catch.

Hey folks!
We've made a solid post over on our website about some of the excellent new features coming out in the Toolkit release. It's an essential read for existing users. Inquisitive new users are welcome too :)

https://arkenforge.com/road-to-the-new-toolkit/

Hey folks!

Apologies for the lack of communication over the last two weeks. We've been absolutely flat out getting everything ready for release, and we're happy to say that the release will be going ahead as scheduled! You'll all be getting access to the Toolkit and Sci Fi Essentials pack in a couple of days :)

This delay will be a  as while the Toolkit is now feature complete and the Sci Fi Essentials pack has shaped up quite nicely, there's a few auxiliary jobs that need to be completed before we can release:

We're only a week away from sending out all your keys, so make sure you get your surveys filled out! If you haven't received it yet, check your junk folder. We're incredibly excited to show you what we've been working on, and we can't wait to see our sci-fi assets out there in the wild!

campaign.story:
In the midst of chaos, only the strong stand any chance of survival. All others will fall: there is no in-between. Fortunately, you knowthat you are ready to take on any foes that challenge you. Whatever comes your way and however daunting the road ahead may seem, you feel confident that you are ready. The power that you need is in your hands.
AKO DICE III
This is, of course, the power of AKO DICE III – the dice that are going to change everything. Holding them in your hand, you are in control of your own destiny. You can chart a new path from here into the future, navigating all of the most treacherous legs along your journey through this strange and frightening world.


 CONCEPT 
AKO DICE III, the latest of the dice in the AKO Dice line, features our new "Dragon Stone" design, which draws inspiration from sci-fi for a unique and thrilling tone. Measuring 16mm x 16mm, AKO DICE III are the convenient and fun dice for long-time players and newcomers alike. The modern linework adds a twist to the normal dice design, while the texture resembles dragon scales, a callback to the idea of a cyber dragon. The pip lines, meanwhile, are the dragon's claw marks, each one representing the value of that face.


PLAY




WHAT YOU GET
Right now, we are looking to raise $10,000 to cover our manufacturing, marketing, and distribution costs. This is the minimum funding level at which AKO DICE III will be viable. If we raise anything above that amount, we will spend the rest on promotions, introducing AKO DICE III to as many people in the gaming community as possible.
To say thanks to everyone who contributes to the campaign, we are offering sets of two AKO DICE III for $25 – plus additional sets for only $20. You get to choose your color finish for any set that you pre-order. (Black, Red, Blue, Green, Purple)
Once the campaign ends, you will receive a survey, through which you will submit your shipping address and your color finish request. We are proud of the work that we have done developing AKO DICE III, but to get it out onto the general market, we are turning to you for support.
While you can pre-order as many AKO DICE III sets as you would like, we are also offering a complete, ten-dice set that includes a case/tower. On top of that, we also create a dice game with FREE print and play for all the cards. we will put a download link for you after the campaign ends. 
Sepcial Limited Edition for Kickstarter Make/100
The AKO Dice complete set comes with dice case/tower
Dice tower assembled from dice case
Based on a minimalist design, AKO DICE III fit inside a single box, meaning that even with a dice tower (included with your complete 10dice set), it is not going to take up too much room on your shelf. The tower can hold up to ten dice at any time, keeping your brand-new AKO DICE III safe and spotless until you are ready to pull them back out again.


PLAY

FREE MINI GAME
We have also created a game "Battle Dragon" that applicable with a collection that you will get from us. Now it can give you and your friend new experience of luxury AKO dice.  In addition, the game is free of charge. All kickstarter fan are welcome to download print and play version without spending a cent !!
"Battle Dragon" is a turn-based card game designed to utilize the complete Dragon Stone set. Each player takes a turn by discarding a card to roll dice and then playing a card to build their dragon. The first player who can command a dragon to attack win the game. Each game includes 17 print-and-play cards and ten dice with five colors for one player. The game supports two or more players. 

 After many designs and testing, we are very satisfied with the final prototype. Using a CNC machining process, we have engineered AKO DICE III with incredible precision, creating world-class dice out of solid aluminum. That means each die is an excellent addition to your gaming collection, sure to add a little personality and excitement the next time you sit down at your favorite gaming table.
PLAY



We also got plan for our Stretch Goal once the project reach over the target funding. So, Please help like and share this project to reach the secret rewards that can be to unlocked more items.  






SHIPPING INFO
Please note that the shipping fee is not included in your pledge. We will calculate the actual shipping cost via pledge manager after the campaign ends. Here is the estimated table cost below. 
One More Way to Help
In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for AKO DICE III by sharing a link to the campaign page on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. If you know anyone who appreciates new styles of dice, make sure that they are aware of what we are doing. Tell any sci-fi and fantasy fans as well. We want to spread the word about AKO DICE III far and wide. You can help us with that. 
We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for your time.

Experienced at running crowdfunding campaigns, we will try our best to solve all of the potential issues. campaign.story:
“You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.” – C.S. Lewis
GAMEPLAY
In Our Last Days, the world learns that a “Planet Killer” class asteroid will strike the Earth in 60 days and end all life as we know it. You will receive 30 days of writing prompts that will guide you in building your own handwritten journal documenting your journey through your last days. Our Last days combines journaling, storytelling, and introspection.
This will be enjoyed by role-players, writers, fans of Sci-Fi/Dystopian stories and anyone willing to really think about what they would do in a disaster situation.
Due to the subject matter it is strongly suggested for mature audiences. The prompts will take you through emotions dealing with the news of realizing Earth’s time has come to an end to the dangers that occur when society breaks down. Will you survive until the end? Do you know yourself as well as you think you do?
In the end you will have a journal that is completely unique to your experience.
REWARDS
Day $5 pledge: You will receive a PDF copy of the 30 days of journal prompts. Delivery February 2021. (Note: the PDF will retail for $8)
Sunset $7 pledge:  You will receive daily email prompts for 30 days, starting in January + receive a copy of the complete PDF (February 21).
Dusk $10 pledge:  You will receive daily email prompts for 30 days, starting in January + receive a copy of the complete PDF (February 21) + this will support 2 community copies being made available as I know this has been a rough year for a lot of people.
Nightfall $20 pledge: You will receive daily email prompts for 30 days (January 2021) + a copy of the PDF (February 2021) + a physical copy of Our Last Days (February 2021).
Midnight $30 pledge (four Spots): Get your photo included in the Our Last Days project. Each prompt comes with a photo to help spark the imagination. You will also receive the email prompts + the final PDF + physical copy of Our Last Days.
THE CREATOR
Robert Brewer is a game-designer, writer and artist of the popular treasure hunt game The Lost Skull, SALT: A Mothership compatible module, The Branches horror graphic novel, Dark Things comics and over 20 published short stories.

The journal is currently being assembled and only pending four final photos. Thank you for supporting small, indie creators.

campaign.story:
Caverns of the Wise Minister is a dark fantasy setting using 5e rules. Halfway between the realms of life and death, a new civilisation of lost souls has sprung up under the thrall of a creature older than gods that calls itself The Wise Minister.
In Caverns, you play denizens of the city of Sepulchre, descendants of those plucked from their homes on the surface, trying to forge a new life in the darkness of the Underworld. If you’re clever, quick, and fortunate, and you live long enough to find your niche, you might learn how you got here. Maybe you’ll even set things right.
Caverns of the Wise Minister’s core funding goal is £2,000 to produce PDF and physical versions of the 40,000+ word setting guide. The book includes 5 new playable races, 4 new subclasses, and 5 new backgrounds, as well as new monsters, spells, magic items, and equipment. Additionally, we have devised new, setting-appropriate mechanics for Social Standing and enhanced Darkness rules.
We want to go further. With your help, we’ll produce a full, level 1-11 adventure path written by some of the best names in the business that explores the mysteries and dangers of the Underworld.
Once upon a time, there stood an elven city called Silverhome, and an aboleth and a deity vied for power over it. The god Empyrea struck down the aboleth, and in revenge it drowned her favoured city. The survivors set out for the Underworld to beg for mercy from the god of death and reclaim the souls of their beloved dead.
They never reached death’s domain.
Instead, they fell under the influence of the being called the Wise Minister, the same vengeful aboleth who had destroyed their home. They built a city in its domain, and it delights in keeping them deep below the earth, tormenting the god they have long forgotten. But that isn’t true vengeance. That can only come when Empyrea is dead. She stole the Wise Minister’s city, and it has nursed that grudge for millennia.
Trapped between life and death, pawns in the games of gods and monsters, thousands of creatures eke out a living in the dark. Those in power know it was not always thus, but it serves their interests to have it remain so.
Sepulchre is a city based on grudges and lies. Stories set here deal with cycles, especially cycles of vengeance, and memory. The aboleth known as the Wise Minister remembers every offence committed against it and plans to avenge them. The cave elves believe its lies — and create a false narrative about their place in the city. Newcomers resent power structures they had no say in, and outsiders try to leave before they can get tangled in the city’s web of traded favours and obligations.
Adventures here feel stifling: there are always constraints, be they physical and environmental — no sky or sun, or dangerous monsters that limit how far it’s safe to range outside the city. Specific themes include:
Power corrupts. This is morally, spiritually, and physically true. The cave elves gained power from the Wise Minister, and independence through the transgressions of their first leader. The elves bear their own curse, their elders transforming into batlike monstrosities, and the Wise Minister’s borrowed power comes with the requirement of complete obedience.
We are all connected. The Wise Minister’s telepathy. The cave elves’ reverie. The nix’s psychic records encoded in coral and the collective wisdom of the uizet. Connections and the community of a shared psychic space are a solace in a dark place. Those connections create in-groups and out-groups, and suspicion between different factions.
The lies we tell ourselves. Our leaders are not monsters. Our homeland is gone. This is our home now. We are happy here. None of these things are true, but life would be unbearable if any of these illusions were pierced. Storytelling in Sepulchre should play heavily on confronting, or finding ways to avoid, uncomfortable truths that could shake the whole realm.
Caught between life and death. Sepulchre and its surrounds are literally, physically, close to the realm of the God of Death. Death is close at hand, and final. For newcomers from the realms above, coming to Sepulchre feels like dying: they are ripped, suddenly and without warning, away from their loved ones and the world they knew. Grief and sorrow are everyday.
Olefsian, ruler of Sepulchre. Art credit: Liz Gist
This book is going to be beautiful. We’ve got some samples of just how it’s going to look when it’s done. None of this is final, but it’s the direction we’re heading in.
ENNIE-nominated designer Jessica Marcrum (Book of Seasons, Uncaged, Age of Sigmar: Soulbound) has written a level zero adventure designed to introduce Caverns of the Wise Minister. You can download it for free now:
Download free Level 0 adventure
As well as the PDF and softcover print versions of the setting, we’ve created a set of add-ons to bring Caverns of the Wise Minister to life, from dice to 3D-printable miniatures. 
All Early Bird backers will get a 15 minute digital soundtrack to set the ambience for your Sepulchre games, at no cost. Music is by Chris Bissette (The Wretched, amongst other outstanding projects), and you can hear a 2-minute taster in the campaign video on this age. 
For this campaign, we are trialing Kickstarter's new add-ons feature! Once you select your main pledge, you will be able to select add-ons. 
 All Stretch Goals UNLOCKED! 
For fulfillment, shipping and customer care, we are partnering with ShipQuest, who run fulfillment for such companies as Modiphius and CMON. Thanks to this partnership, we are able to offer relatively low shipping rates. 
EU-based backers will have their orders shipped from ShipQuest's Germany hub, so that they won't be impacted by Brexit. 
Note: All shipping prices are estimates based on Oct 2020 rates and may change by time of reward fulfillment. Shipping will be collected in the pledge manager post-campaign.
 CAT EVANS (@perpetualgloom), Co-lead - Cat is a professional RPG writer and designer who has published work for Outbreak Undead, Age of Sigmar: Soulbound, and D&D Adventurers League (Season 9) as well as numerous DMs Guild and itch.io titles. She has upcoming work for Trophy Gold, Vampire: the Masquerade, Mage: the Ascension, Altered Carbon, and more. Setting design is her favourite thing to do, because without a living, breathing, organic setting, every roleplaying adventure feels hollow. She can tell you more than you want to know about how Sepulchre’s sewage system works (please don’t ask her).
LIZ GIST (@crit_liz), Co-lead - Liz is a queer, genderfae artist and writer who has worked on DM’s Guild projects such as Uncaged, Unbridled, Grandmother Crookbesom’s Book of Hags and Masks of Theros. They love nothing more than gothic horror and wriggling around in a setting to make it as intricately disturbing as possible.
ALEX CLIPPINGER (@aclippinger), Writer - Alex has a number of titles on the DM's Guild, and has worked with publishers like PB Publishing, Loresmyth, and Petersen Games. He's looking forward to bringing something weird or maybe something spooky to the Dreadful Realms.
STEFFIE DE VAAN (@100thingsIlove), Writer - Steffie is a Dutch author and developer of role playing games and short stories. She developed the Legendlore RPG and V5: Fall of London, and has written for many other settings including Vampire the Masquerade, Changeling the Lost, Exalted, and Harlem Unbound. She loves horror, fantasy, sci-fi stories, and their cross genres in any medium; watching short films and tutorials on YouTube; and inclusive feminism.
ALISON HUANG (@Drazillion), Writer - Alison is a two time ENnie winning Australian writer best known for her contributions to the Uncaged Anthology and the RPG Writer Workshop.
JESSICA MARCRUM (@miss_jess03), Writer - Jess is a social worker, silver ENnie winner, and three time ENnie nominee who has written for Age of Sigmar: Soulbound, A brain witch by day, she spends her evenings creating games, supplements, and other ttrpg goodies including the Book of Seasons, College of Caterwauling, and Dumpster Fire. You can find her website at jessicamarcrumwrites.com
J. F. SAMBRANO (@jfhigh), Writer - J. F. Sambrano is a Cora and Chiricahua author of horror and fantasy and has worked on TTRPGs for Hunters Entertainment, Renegade Studios, and Onyx Path Publishing. They are a historian specializing in Indigenous and pre-colonial histories of the Americas as well as being an unabashed, unapologetic wagon burner.
KC SHI (@KCShiWrites), Writer - KC has written for DMs Guild anthologies like Uncaged and Unbreakable, as well as Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound. She hopes to bring her knowledge of cave-dwelling creatures to Sepulchre, seeing as she has recently done her best to become one.
CHRISTOPHER WALZ (@ChrisWalzEdits), Editor - Chris is a father, writer, and editor from central Kentucky. His first memories of roleplaying games are going through his older brother's stack of books before he could read—one had a flying eye-monster on it. He's been writing and editing for RPGs since 2016 and had the opportunity to turn it into a career in 2019 when he became a staff editor at Cubicle 7, publishers of Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay and others. He has various works on the Dungeon Masters Guild and has been a freelance writer for Onyx Path Publishing and others. Chris has a passionate hatred of cottage cheese.
SAGA MACKENZIE (@pyxistyxGWJ), Cartographer - Saga is a queer, transgender illustrator and TTRPG designer working out of the Highlands of Scotland. With a wide range of genre influences and experience with several media, Saga creates beautiful, user-friendly fantasy maps with (for Dreadful Realms) a touch of horror about them. You can see more of her work at smackfolio.wordpress.com/portfolio/ttrpgmaps/
DAVID MARKIWSKY (@DavidMarkiwsky), Artist - David has written and produced art for a number of RPG projects including Uncaged, Gimble's Guide to the Feywild and Unbridled. He brings dark fantasy, folk horror and fey shenanigans to everything he touches and can't wait to bring all the locations in Dreadful Realms to life.

The setting guide itself is written. It just needs to be edited and laid out. We’re very confident that we’ll deliver the PDF, and all other digital rewards, on time.

Physical rewards… it’s been quite a year. Production and shipping times are slower than usual, and between Brexit and the ongoing pandemic, we can’t give you an ironclad guarantee there will be no disruption to delivery. However, we’ve built in plenty of time for delays and we have an excellent fulfilment partner in ShipQuest, so we’re reasonably confident that we’ve minimised the risks.

updates.update_content:
Just a quick update: we've finished testing the pledge manager ourselves, and soft-launched it with a very, very small group of backers. If His Aquatic Munificence wills it, we'll be inviting everyone else within 48 hours. 
We've also had some really satisfying conversations about sleep patterns in a place without a day/night cycle, and are lovingly hand-crafting horrible Underworld denizens, so it's safe to say the last of the writing's going well too.

Hello cave dwellers!
Life is unpredictable and time has gotten away from us just a wee bit. Unlike the Wise Minister, we are - alas - only human, and we thank you all for your patience as we get the pledge manager ready.
The good news is, it's all set up! We just have some final testing to do before we go live, which means your pledge manager links should be fluttering out on digital bat wings within the next week.

updates.update_userinfo: Timeline Update and Realm Map Preview
updates.update_content:
Hello cave dwellers!
It's been just over a month since our last update, and in that time, Cat and I have made some important decisions based on the timeline of the project.
Even more excitingly, we also have a WIP preview of the realm map that Saga is busy working on! This map is a complex beast that Saga has handled with beautiful grace, showing the entirety of the Wise Minister's realm within the Underworld. The only part to be finalised is Sepulchre itself, which is currently missing from the map.

Hello our lovely cave dwellers!
There are a few quick bits of housekeeping that we'd like to update you on.
First of all, Liz has recently changed their name - they are now Lore Evans.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Year, and we're rolling!
updates.update_content:
Happy New Year! We hope the first few hours of 2021 have treated you well. 
The Kickstarter funds arrived in our bank account on New Year's Eve, which was a very nice way to end the year. Everything now feels very real, and we're excited to move forward with Dreadful Realms after our end of year break.

Wow, this has been quite a ride. The campaign wrapped a little under 12 hours ago, and we're still reeling from its success.
We are so very excited to bring the first Dreadful Realm to life, both through the setting guide and the adventure path. There's so much work to be done, and we couldn't have done it without all of you.
What's next?

Thank you!
We've unlocked our final stretch goal: a 30 minute atmospheric soundtrack by Chris Bissette! Chris is an amazing musician who has previously created soundtracks for their games, such as The Wretched.
The soundtrack is available as an add-on for £5. Anyone who has an Early Bird or Limited Edition pledge will receive the soundtrack for free!

It's been a busy few days, huh? Since our last update on Friday, we've rocketed up through both of our art stretch goals and our goal of more beautiful maps from Saga MacKenzie! This is incredible progress, and we're so grateful to all of you! 
As of now, we're heading steadily towards our penultimate planned stretch goal: more pay for our writers! As a new TTRPG company working with a small budget, this goal is very near and dear to us.

campaign.story:
The Wildsea is a tabletop roleplaying game from Quillhound Studios for 2-6 players inspired by stories like Sunless Sea, Bastion, and the Bas-Lag Trilogy. Set in a world overrun by greenery, Wildsea uses a narrative, fiction-first d6 dicepool system that draws inspiration from games like Belly of the Beast, Blades in the Dark, and 13th Age. 
Clickthrough to access the Quick Start Rules!
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to produce and print a 1st edition of the Wildsea RPG. This is a production Kickstarter: after the campaign closes, we'll be using the funds raised to create a fully realized beautiful rulebook. The budget goal of $15,000 represents the minimum amount needed to bring the book to life with the resources we currently have available. 
Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of the RPG, adding more content, art, professional layouts, and an offset print run to deliver a premium tabletop roleplaying book that will be a showcase for any collection. 
 Some three hundred years ago the empires of the world were toppled by a wave of fast growing greenery, a tide of rampant growth spilling from the West known as the Verdancy. 
Now chainsaw-driven ships cut their way across dense treetop waves, their engines powered by oilfruit, rope-golems, honey and pride.
You play a wildsailor, part of a motley crew consisting of humanity's weathered descendants, cactoid gunslingers, centipedal fungi, silk-clothed spiderfolk, and other, stranger things. 
With your fellow crewmembers, you'll journey across the lingin' tide discovering charts, pursuing drives, and avoiding mires of the deep. 
The Wildsea hungers and grows, roots sinking deep into the forest floor as the waves above ripple with life.  What will you discover in its depths? 



Check out our Actual Play on the Don't Forget Your Towel Podcast!
The Wildsea is a fiction-first roleplaying game with narrative and character decisions driving your interaction with the mechanics of the Wild Words engine. The game uses a d6 narrative dicepool system that constantly pushes the story forward.
At character creation, players select a Bloodline, Origin and Post, each with a variety of options to inform and customize a character's background and playstyle:
The four core bloodlines of the Wildsea: the cactuslike Ektus, Ardent survivors, hive spider Tzelicrae, and fungi Gau.
 Your Edges represent the way in which your character is most used to solving problems. Your Grace, Iron, Instinct, Sharps, Teeth, Tides, or Veils. 
Your Skills are more specific areas in which your character has training or a natural advantage. Things like Climbing, Charming, Cooking, Breaking, or Scavenging. 
You also have Aspects - gear, traits, or companions - that can be used, expended, or damaged throughout the course of play. 
 Resources are useful oddities, short term expendables used for things like whispers, scavenge, and specimens.
Your known Languages allow you to engage with different people and cultures in the diverse world of the Wildsea.  
Finally, your Drives and Mires define your personality, motivation, and long term goals. 
Each crew will also have their own ship, a vessel capable of braving the unique challenges of the lingin tide. You might cut a path with a chainsaw-ridged prow, drag yourself with hooks and grapples or scuttle from branch to branch on insectile limbs.
Customize and upgrade  your ship by designing its Size, Frame, Hull, Bite, and Engine, and outfitting  it with different Fittings. Make it your home on the waves! 
Stories and Characters develop as the crew pursues milestones, while time in the game is abstracted through three distinct phases: scenes, montages, and journeys. 
The Wildsea will initially be presented in landscape, 11.5 x 8.5'' inch (~29 x 22 cm) hardcover book with around 200 pages of mostly black and white interiors punctuated by full color spread chapter headings.  
Mockup. Artwork and Design of Physical Book not final. Design shown is a hardcover perfect bound edition that would only be unlocked should we reach certain stretch goal milestones.
As the campaign grows, so will the quality and contents of the book. Should we reach certain stretch goals, we will upgrade the physical book to a 3-piece clothbound, full colour, sewn book sure to be a centerpiece of any collection. For more information, see the Stretch Goals section below.
The initial funding goal of $15,000 represents the bare minimum for the creators to produce and print physical copies of the book and recoup the funds already expended by the creator to the artists. 

Community Copies: At Collector's Edition and above tiers, we'll include additional digital Community Copies to be claimed by the public. Community Copies provide a way for those with less means to enjoy content and are a feature of Itch.io. When our page on the platform goes live, we'll add Community Copies commensurate with the amount of backers we have at higher tiers.

Shipping is not included in the pledge levels for this campaign and will be calculated and added on when we are ready to ship via Backerkit. This is a production Kickstarter and it may be up to a year before we start shipping out physical copies. It would therefore be inaccurate  to include the shipping rates as part of the funds raised for this campaign. 
As in: you will not be charged additional VAT or Customs Taxes on your shipped goods.
Mythopoeia is currently in the process of partnering with fulfillment centers based all over the world to deliver customs-friendly shipping, including to Europe and Oceania.  According to our most recent quotes, packages for a <1kg (~2 lbs) package average around $7.50 to the USA, UK, Germany, and Netherlands and around $20 to Oceania and Canada. 

Shipping has been quite tumultuous in recent months due to the ongoing pandemic and politics. Canadian postage from the USA seems to have taken a dramatic spike over the past four years. This is a problem we are actively working on. If you know any local Canadian or Australian distributors for USA goods, we would love to hear from you!

If we reach our initial goal of $15,000, we'll include new Origins for character creation not seen in the Quickstart Rules! We'll also throw in a set of digital wallpapers and other high resolution Wildsea Artwork as part of the Kickstarter exclusive digital bonuses. 
At $17,000 we will be able to commission a full Wildsea Soundtrack from the amazing Liam P. Vaughan, composer of Thrash, Tangle, Sink, the song used in our Kickstarter video!  
At $20,000 we'll be able to afford to turn the book from mostly black and white to full colour! To do so will require us to go back and recolour about two thirds of our total art assets - a significant endeavor! 

At $25,000 we'll bring on board a Professional Layout Artist to help design the final look of the book!  We'll also produce and release Virtual Play Surfaces to facilitate online play on your favorite platforms of choice.

At $30,000 we'll be able to raise the rates of our artists as well as commission an expanded bestiary from bestiary artist Katy Shmeckerel (@schmeckerel)! 
At $32,000 we'll release the SRD for the Wild Words Engine, allowing you to hack and release your own games! To celebrate this milestone, we'll also be commissioning Creators to create new content for the Wildsea including new factions, beasts, and  ships, and perhaps even additional Reaches...
At $35,000 we'll be able to upgrade the specs of both the Standard and Collector's Edition of The Wildsea! This may include things like an offset print run, three piece clothbound hardcover, and embossed finish. 
At $37,000 we'll include a chapter on Arconautics - the study of the weird and strange. Arconautics presents an array of additional options for both players and Fireflies that want to embrace the extraordinary - alchemists, augurs, ironbound automatons, manipulators of metal and plantlife. Includes new bloodlines, origins, posts, skills, and hazards! 
At $40,000 we'll be able to spare no expense when it comes to printing the book, including being able to lower our carbon footprint by printing locally. We will also will look into more printing bells and whistles like foil stamping, endsheets, booksmarks, et. all.
At $42,000 we'll be able to bring on even more Creators to create content for the Wildsea! We'll announce if we get here, but preliminary discussions have included an appendix on gardening, and ventures deep into the undiscovered waves...
At $45,000 we'll be able to raise the rates of our artists yet again and commission more artwork for the final book. Perhaps we might even be able to include an illustrated Chart or three...
 At $50,000 we'll be able to produce a fully realized actual play of the Wildsea for your viewing enjoyment! This may include partnering with an existing show or perhaps striking out on our own. Details to come if we get here! 
At $55,000 we'll be able to add a set of ship creation options, unique hazards and Firefly guidance based around the ideas of exploring the upper skies and lower branches. Now we just have to work out what to call a submarine... 
At $60,000 we'll set aside a portion of the funds to subsidize the shipping fees for the project. This will hopefully enable us to lower shipping rates by $1-2 dollars per package, depending on a number of factors. Internally, what this means is that no matter what we will allocate a portion of our funds raised to shipping costs, which we'll then pass the savings unto you when it comes time to charge and fulfill via Backerkit.
At $65,000 we're going to pay Wildsea creator and designer Felix Isaacs more! The majority of funds raised from  the last stretch goal to this one will go directly to Felix in addition to his overall cut of the campaign and future sales.
At $70,000 we'll be able to raise the per word rate of the various designers and writers we are bringing on board to the Wildsea (which I promise we'll announce soon in a future update). Freelance game design is not exactly a lucrative profession but we're committed to building a bigger tent and providing opportunities to others when and where  we can.
At $75,000 we'll be able to design and manufacture a set of custom  wooden Wildsea Dice which will be available to purchase as an Add-On via BackerKit. This is something we wanted to have ready for the start of the campaign but alas simply ran out of time. Nonetheless, reaching this tier will give us the resources to begin the process of making these dice in earnest.
Handcrafted dice from Might Dog Games. Now available as add-ons.
At $85,000 we'll include the last content update for the core book: The Farthest Reaches. Consider this an expansion of the Arconautics chapter already unlocked detailing the furthest corners of the Wildsea. More obscure content, to be announced if we get here!

Finally, our ultimate goal at $100,000 will allow us to lower shipping rates yet again, reducing the rates by another $1-2 per package. In the interim, the funds raised to get this tier will allow us to pay the principles of the project just that little bit more :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a production Kickstarter, the primary risk is that the book still needs to be created in full before printing and distribution can begin. For that reason we typically like to run print Kickstarters where the product is already completed instead, but sometimes that's not possible when launching a new and amazing project like the Wildsea! 

Ray and Vince bring over six years and 13 projects worth of crowdfunding experience into this campaign. We know how to produce beautiful books and communicate with our backers and fans on every step of the process. We strive to have 100% satisfaction guaranteed when it comes our projects - ask our past backers about their experience! 

We gave ourselves a wide breadth for the campaign - almost a full year - but should we meet and exceed our goals, we will use that time to build a better world filled with gorgeous art and a handsome book you'll be proud to have on your shelves. There is always the possibility that things may be delayed further. We will do our best to deliver in a timely matter while maintaining transparency and striving always for the highest quality work possible.

Shipping is another major uncertainty heading into the year 2021. The state of global politics means that things like postal rates and customs and tariffs are in a constant state of flux. Brexit and the USA/China trade war may impact the printing and manufacturing of the Wildsea in ways we cannot foresee. Nonetheless, we will do our best to navigate these uncharted waters, just as we have done for the past four years. 

Backing this project means you're not only buying the book, but helping produce the work to make it real. For that we can't thank you enough. Together, we'll build something amazing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
